abstract: William R. Hambrecht, the veteran venture capitalist, spoke with The New York Times’s Holly Hubbard Preston about the changes he had seen during a 52-year career, and what he still hoped to accomplish.
snippet: William R. Hambrecht, the veteran venture capitalist, spoke with The New York Times’s Holly Hubbard Preston about the changes he had seen during a 52-year career, and what he still hoped to accomplish.
lead_paragraph: William R. Hambrecht helped usher in the high-technology age in the 1980s by being an early venture investor in Apple , Genentech and a host of other industry pioneers. Hambrecht & Quist, the investment firm he co-founded, was also the lead underwriter of many of the initial public stock offerings of these companies.

headline.main: The Man Who Shook Up Underwriting
